website_summaries.verdict: A solid design by a popular name in music components with the trade offs being the high price and some unexpected quality concerns.
pros: With its 5-disc CD changer, balanced sound, and handsome looks, it has features and functions that are synonymous with the Sony name
cons: The design is on the wide side

customer_reviews.title: Excellent,  mine is still going...
customer_reviews.text: with nonstop use. Must have music in my life all the time, and my show puppies go to sleep to classical music, e.g., Brahms Lullaby or Pachelbel's Canon, and three other soothing sonatas for piano and strings. So the player has gone 4 years nonstop. I bought mine on Amazon in 2015, am worried it won't last much longer with such use. EBay has several new left for $169.00, so purchased another as back up---call me old school, but give me CD's over MP3s in sound quality any day. When working at home, just put in 5 discs from my "gigango" eclectic library, and let myself "float away" as it were. Legere de Coeurs Belgian Tervuren M.L. Powers, MS
customer_reviews.author: M.L. Powers, MS

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in good condition. It replaces a beloved, over 25 year old Technics carousel that finally gave up, and could not play the newer formats. I took off one star because it is noisy on opening and adding/changing discs. Sitting the same distance from this changer as from the Technics, you could not hear the Technics when it changed discs. So far, plays very well, with very good sound. We use our OPPO 103's when playing individual discs, but use the Sony when doing something that would make it inconvenient to change out 1 disc at a time. Other than the noise, we have experienced none of the trouble mentioned in some of the other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: relaxretired

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed with Sony.  Only Lasted 18 Months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 5-Disk CD Player based on Sony's brand reputation. The CD player broke after only 18 months. The drawer is stuck in the open position, the carousel tray won't stop rotating, and the power will not shut off without pulling the plug. So I've pulled the plug on this Sony product -- its not worth the money for 1-1/2 years of enjoyment. Listen to music on your mobile devises. Save your money on this CD Player.
customer_reviews.author: TexShop

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this five stars for the overall value. My unit has been reliable. I purchased it in December 2011. I've now been using it for almost four years. No problems so far. It does not get what I would consider heavy use. I do use it regularly, just not every day. Higher end more expensive units will give you better fidelity, but for the average listener, the sound quality produced by this unit is fine. For the money, this model is a good deal. For the current sale price of $98.00, this is a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: 4jacks

customer_reviews.title: This one must have been made with bitcoins...
customer_reviews.text: Besides having bought this same model no. on Amazon in 2012 for only $120.99, I had two CDs get jammed inside the unit recently and had to remove the top panel to remove them. Luckily the CDs were not damaged. Also, it choked pretty badly on some MP3s I had on a flash drive. This was a pretty good buy at the 2012 price, but $900 now? I thought the cost of old technology went down. Looks like I made a damn good investment! Maybe I'll hang onto it. Maybe it was made with bitcoins?
customer_reviews.author: ArtOfFugue

customer_reviews.title: The big PAUSE
customer_reviews.text: Had it just about a year when it started to pause during payback. At first it was just random and lasted a second or two, then it progressed to where it can't get more than a few seconds without pausing. Hitting "play" again doesn't help, cleaning the laser reader doesn't help, hitting pause then play again doesn't help. I am at a loss and kind of po'd about it. The CD's aren't damaged. They all play fine on other devices. Too much money for such a non-functioning item.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Gearig

customer_reviews.title: Great 5-Disc CD Player
customer_reviews.text: This CD Player is exactly what I was looking for and was in great condition with all original cords, manual and remote (that even had batteries!) We previously had a 300-disc player that kept breaking and wasn't able to be fixed to work with a full load of CDs, so this is a better solution for us and should be easier to fix if it breaks. Highly recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri D.

customer_reviews.title: I can hear the music!
customer_reviews.text: Was specifically looking for a five-disk changer. Good CD player for the price. Like the ability to "shuffle" all five disks for playback. Sensitive "laser reader" seems to have issues with most any scratch, fingerprint, dirt on your disk, so if you have old beat-up ones or don't keep your disks clean, you could have problems with playback. Sound quality is good. Would buy again and recommend to others if just seeking a simple multi-disk player.
customer_reviews.author: angienav

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my CD player I love the fact that I can put in 5 CDs put it on shuffle and get it different artists with every song or I can choose to listen to one CD at a time. Was very happy to find this since it is actually a replacement for one that I used to have that worked exactly the same way and I was afraid I was not going to be able to find another one that work this way. So I am very happy
customer_reviews.author: syns10

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until recently
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April 2014. Worked fine until recently. Then the CDs would start coming out of the trays and bunching up. Changed CD's, checked manual and reloaded. Disk tray would not retract. Pushed a little and tray locked in and all I get is an error reading. No solution in the book except to take to dealer. Anyone know a repair site in Tucson that would not charge me more than just buying a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A relic from the 90's with a 21st Century twist. Flawless operation as only Sony can do. Clunky and mechanical like the 90's, but that is what I knew I was getting and I love it. I was using a DVD player as my CD player for a number of years because CD players weren't in stores anymore. There is a HUGE difference in sound quality. A great choice for a dying format. However, CDs will remain my choice for saving music PERMANENTLY, something one cannot say for computers and mp3 players.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kluttz

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Product.
customer_reviews.text: A Great Product from Sony. I purchased one in 1990 & it finally died due to being in storage in the heat & cold for 10 years. This one has all the Bells & Whistles like a USB port & MP3 capability that my old one didn't have plus Digital Out Optical (cord for optical is extra cost). This one is totally compatible with my Sherwood RX-4109 AM/FM Receiver/ Amplifier that it hooks up to. Worth ever penny & received in 4 days from Amazon.com. GOOD JOB!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This changer is perfect for my needs and a quality piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: My 30 Year old Sony 5-Disc CD changer finally failed and I needed to replace it or otherwise ditch my CD collection. This changer is perfect for my needs and a quality piece of equipment. Can't beat the price unless you look at used and I am not taking that risk! Good deal for a good product. Paid $99.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing a 15 year old Panasonic that stopped working. First of all, I have a Sony audio/video control center, so it is nice being able to turn the CD player on and off with the same control. It works great. The only thing I miss is the ability to mix up the CD's playing back, but that is a minor detail.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: tracked each channel well and gave what appeared to be excellent sonic reproduction of the material -- much clearer than ...
customer_reviews.text: Not being electronically savvy, I can only say this item worked perfectly either with one or up to 5 CD's, tracked each channel well and gave what appeared to be excellent sonic reproduction of the material -- much clearer than the item it replaced. It also has several other options such as use of a flash drive and other recording sources. It was easy to set up with clear instructions provided.The seller was, likewise, perfect in terms of shipping the item well-packaged and promptly. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: TMK

customer_reviews.title: Sony CD Player
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunate that some reviewers have had problems with this. I replaced my 12 year old JVC that has served me well. In fact the JVC is STILL working just fine, but I wanted to have the optical input so upgraded to the Sony. Noticeable difference in sound from analog ! The Sony is noisy and slow, but not too much different from JVC. For the price the Sony works as expected. Paired up with my new Yamaha Aventage receiver the Sony is great. Was gonna by a Yamaha CD player but don't need to pay 150 to 200 or 300 bucks for more bells and whistles that I don't need.
customer_reviews.author: Robear

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have used the changer for 2 weeks. Easy install, very good remove, large bright display on player. No complaints so far i will come back in a few months to update The sound seems better than that of my 15 year ofl DENON multi disc player. That unit lasted a long time, cost $300 and finally died this year.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Brostek

customer_reviews.title: Was so gald to find I could buy one of these - and such a nice one too.
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all - wish it wasn't so damn deep as I had to move my whole set up out away form the wall another two inches to accommodate it. Still - was thrilled that I was able to, in 2015, buy a good cd player from a good company. I can't imagine Sony makes a single $$$ on making these for consumers.
customer_reviews.author: E. E. Mort

customer_reviews.title: Not many to choose from
customer_reviews.text: The 5-disc changer does a good job of playing CD's, but I'm not fan of the design. It seems unnecessarily wide, the layout of the controls on the face of the unit likewise seems to be unnecessarily spread out. When the unit switches to play a different disc, it makes a rather loud and "clunky" sound that I did not have on the previous CD changers I owned. However, it appears that not many electronic manufacturers are producing CD changers anymore, so considering the very reasonable price and the lack of competition, I feel like I definitely got my money's worth from this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Buch

customer_reviews.title: A good, basic CD player.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this has proven to be a good, basic CD player. I was somewhat reluctant to purchase this player, as I've found Sony products to be hit-and-miss, but this has proven to be a good product, so far. It's not super sturdy, but I've used it daily for some time, and have had no problems. I purchased it along with the Sony STRDH 130 2-channel receiver, and it has been quite compatible. Additionally, I've found the remote to be well designed and easy to use. This has proven to be a good product, at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Rayman

customer_reviews.title: it's "OK"...but...
customer_reviews.text: I had a predecessor model that was heavily used for more than a decade and needed replacing. This was the sony model that came closest to it, but, while it does what it is supposed to do, the features(advance on track at a time, repeat and scramble options, etc are either not there at all or harder to find. The black-on-black lettering/numbering means either you have flash light or you are on your knees to get a closer look. In the end, I painted the numbers and/or used a white on black labeler for earier viewing of the controls. In short, it does what it is supposed to do, but it is nothing like its predecessor. dd
customer_reviews.author: D. Domizio

customer_reviews.title: Loaded and cheap to buy
customer_reviews.text: What steal!!! This unit has features galore and great sound too. The USB port means you can load up the flash drive and listen for hours. CD players in general and changers in particular are becoming hard to pickup as most manufacturers just let the DVD player fill the gap. That is not what I wanted; Sony cd changer offered the best features when compared to the Yamaha and Onkyo units.
customer_reviews.author: W. Beasley

customer_reviews.title: A good product at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: This one works really well. My husband and I are really happy - about three months in. Our other Sony (12 years old and Perfect - died as a result of a direct hit of lightening) First I bought TEAC - and it was really disappointing.....just did not work at all. This one works well. Even the remote works well for shuffle or repeat. The one thing that is less than perfect is that it shuts down after running 5 discs. And this is not a major problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: and I have liked them all
customer_reviews.text: This is my third, and I have liked them all. I am old-fashioned and still play CDs (and vinyl).
customer_reviews.author: EditorMotz

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes, you just gotta roll the dice
customer_reviews.text: Player stops and starts a lot . Then it reads all the way to the end of the disk. It's also very slow in reading selections even on pre-recorded disks. It will only read up to 255 (?) selections on the usb stick. I got it used thru Amazon. I'm not sure if a new one would be any better after reading other reviews. I'll try and find a repair facility. Sony's website is a confused mess. When it's working the sound is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Yankee station

customer_reviews.title: Good buy on a 5 CD player
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a 5 CD player for listening to Christmas music. Amazon had this player at a good price and I bought it for her. It works very well with only one minor exception. The CD player on the second use would not do anything. I unplugged and plugged it back in and everything has worked since then. I hope this does not happen again. With a 5 CD changer we can listen to hours of music without having to change the CD; it does it for us. I gave it only 4 stars b/c of the one problem. I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: dfrank1251

customer_reviews.title: Great Refurb
customer_reviews.text: This product has been wonderful so far. It came packaged very well. It works well and we needed it to replace and old system. It has served its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Rae Husbands

customer_reviews.title: The display would say "reading" for what seemed like an abnormally long time and then would say "no ...
customer_reviews.text: . I went with this one for rating and price. The unit I received could not read any discs, period. The display would say "reading" for what seemed like an abnormally long time and then would say "no disc" although the tray was fully loaded with clean factory CD's. The carousel seemed very noisy and clunky. I have sent it back for a replacement as it seems about 15% of these units arrive broken but most people are happy with them so I will try again.
customer_reviews.author: Flavious

customer_reviews.title: A winner so far
customer_reviews.text: Had the unit a couple months and it works perfectly so far. Better sound quality than my previous Sony unit that lasted 20 years. If this unit lasts only 19 years I'll be happy. If there are any problems with the new unit, I'll let you know.
customer_reviews.author: John M O Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Great Sony CD Changer
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this Sony CDP-CE500 D-Disc Changer and love it, however I can't seem to get the remote to work which came after I received the changer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. October

customer_reviews.title: Okay CD Player
customer_reviews.text: This player works as it should. Good sound, okay looks, labels in the front are really small, a bit noisy when switching CDs, sound quality of the burned CDs are better than MP3s from USB, it takes a long time to read 172 MP3 songs burned to CDs, etc. My gripe about this player is it does not remember the part of the song where it stopped. It always play the first track of the CD when turned on. It is annoying to me because I do not want to hear a repeat but wanted to start where I left off. However, I am keeping this player since I do not have much of a choice out there.
customer_reviews.author: Bert de Leon

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent solution for handling both CDs and MP3s on a USB. Lately have only using it with USB drives. Excellent quality and handles the MP3s very well. For our purposes better than just having a playlist and playing through it. The MP3s are organized on the USB by genre, artist, album and can play all of them. Playing CDs and CDs with MP3s has been very good, too. Some solutions built into the receivers to support iPods and USBs are not as versatile. Have gotten a few of these units for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: buy2use

customer_reviews.title: Product-0, Ocean Reef+5 + update
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished product was unusable upon receipt. Ocean Reef Electronics was more than helpful resolving the issue. Return was fairly painless but refunding was outstanding. Update 07/11/13 Haven't used MP3 yet so don't know about the USB. Changer is extremely groovy. Listen to lots of music and was using a Sony DVD player to listen to discs. Got very tired of changing discs. I play tunes in a small room with Sony stereo 135/2 receiver, Sony SSF6000 and SSB3000 speakers and Polk PSW10 sub and the sound is mega rock the Casbah.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: CDs cut in and out all the time. It's ...
customer_reviews.text: CDs cut in and out all the time. It's still possible to listen to them, but all the skipping is very disruptive. Unfortunately, I bought it as a gift for my wife a month early, and by the timeI gave it to her and we figured out that it was skipping, it was outside the return window. The lesson is, if you're going to buy a gift on Amazon, don't buy it early or you might not be able to return it if there's a problem.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: So glad it's available
customer_reviews.text: We bought our first Sony CDP CD Player roughly 20 years ago. Flawless performance. Alas, it died recently and we needed a replacement. While we could have gone to an iPod + speakers approach, we chose to stick with this Sony product. While it has been improved through the years, it is quite similar to our old Sony CD player, very intuitive to operate. We are very accustomed to popping 5 CDs into the Sony player and having an evening of quickly-selected music on tap for visitors. We wanted to continue to have this feature, so we are tickled to have purchased this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tampa Views

customer_reviews.title: They Just Don't Make Them Like They Used To
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player because I thought my ten-year old Sony CDP-CE215 was broken (skipping on every CD). I must say that I would much prefer to have my older unit restored but no one will work on it. The new player is lighter, noisier when changing discs, and has more economically-made buttons and switches. If anyone knows who may help me repair my old unit (it now fails to recognize any discs and continues to move through all five disc positions), please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Strobel

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It would not shuffle and didn’t play a lot of my discs
customer_reviews.author: ebbtideblue

customer_reviews.title: One of the very few CD carrousel players still in production, economic price and contruction
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the very few CD carrousel players still in production, Marantz, Denon and many more have discontinued this product for over a year. This unit has an economic price and contruction quality. If you are looking for a good CD player and doesn't mind a single tray player then buy a Marantz CD player, if you want the 5-disc carrousel convenience then this is a very reasonable option.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Cordero

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good... I read lots of reviews of this and other machines -- all had good and bad.entries, but this one was pretty consistently decent, and was considerably less expensive for a multi-CD changer -- which can suggest both good and bad. I had a couple of initial one-channel problems, but turns out one was my own fault (wiring). I play a lot of dubbed CDs (from cassette tapes), so some of the minor glitches could also be there -- mostly drop-out of one channel at the very beginning, and not consistent. So-- cannot blame it on the machine; otherwise very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Maryland guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Simple.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit that is easy to use as well. I have always owned single disc CD players because of the horror stories that I have been told about from the multi-disc players. I listen to more Vinyl than anything but this unit is played on a daily basis and continues to serve me well. It is nice to load up 5 discs and sit back and enjoy the Music. It is by no means a top of the line Model but I have not had any problems since day one and I promise that I will update this review if things change.
customer_reviews.author: bobliwienski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup but spins tracks in some CDs
customer_reviews.text: very easy to setup. the recording feature is unique in it's class. Not giving 5 stars because it spins tracks in some CDs for no reason (CDs had immaculate surface and played well in other players). I have seen that bad review from other reviewers. Hopefully it doesn't get worst with time as I have read from other reviews as well. Sound is plain and sharp, would recommend to attach a good equalizer. It is a shame it is no longer for sale at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Feliponcho

customer_reviews.title: Music to my ears
customer_reviews.text: After a decade or so, our Magnavox CD changer decided to go kaput, saw the good reviews, not to mention the very reasonable price, hard to beat, plus free shipping--add to that the name "SONY," and we took the plunge. We ordered it on a Saturday, it arrived that Tuesday, was installed same night, plays beautifully. I don't know if this will be playing beautiful music for me for another decade or so, but so far so good; and for the price, I won't lose sleep over it. Didn't need a $650 unit like some others out there; this is just what we need. Remote is easy to use, not too many bells or whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: BOUGHT THIS SONY TO REPLACE MY BROKEN HARMON KARDON FL 8385 5-DISC CD PLAYER.
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS SONY TO REPLACE MY BROKEN HARMON KARDON FL 8385 5-DISC CD PLAYER. IT WORKS! NO ISSUES! BEAUTIFUL, SLEEK, CLASSIC DESIGN. EASY TO USE. RELIABLE AND VERY REASONABLY PRICED COMPARED TO THE COMPETITION! THIS IS SONY IS A KEEPER!!! HOPE TO FIX THE HARMON KARDON UNIT WHICH GOES WITH MY WHOLE HARMON KARDON MUSIC SYSTEM, BUT IF NOT, THIS WILL CERTAINLY DO.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Endless Music!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had a 5 CD player and was dismayed when my unit of many years broke down. After reviewing options, I selected this Sony 5 CD player in its place. I have been enjoying the music...good sound, easy use (remote) and for the most part, everything that I was looking for in a replacement. I have it hooked up to my stereo using great speakers, so that makes the sound very enjoyable. I know there are not too many units of this nature around these days since most people load music into IPods. Anyone looking for ease of use and continuious music, will also feel this is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: madeleine

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Initially, I was hesitant to purchase a Sony however after doing some research and reading a volume of reviews, I decided to take a chance. For the price paid, I was totally impressed with the sound. I have a very, very, old Akai un-integrated system which I refuse to part with. Despite it's age it still blows away any and all competition for sound and clarity and this CD player is a perfect fit. You can not go wrong with this one!!!
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: GLAD WE BOUGHT
customer_reviews.text: A 5 CD changer is hard to find. I was very happy to find it on Amazon. When we bought it, we did not realize that we also needed an amplifier to make it work. We ordered an amplifier from Amazon and the Disc Player works GREAT!!!! My husband finally has his music that he dearly loves, in his MAN CAVE:). He also can put the speakers outside, when he is gardening. His DREAM COME TRUE!! It comes with a remote. It has a shuffle button, so that it will select music from all CD'S at random. You won't be sorry with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good replacement unit
customer_reviews.text: Have an older Sony stereo receiver sound system, this unit is for newer receivers. Older unit (which they don't make anymore) has all the bells & whistles built into the CD player. In newer stereo systems, everything is controlled from the primary receiver. The CDP-CE500 is probably a very good player. But in my case, older is better ( individual disc programing, random access to all five discs, various sound fields w/bass boost ) Also works with Sony system remote.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Mandiak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect price with high-end sound
customer_reviews.text: I priced this same unit on several sites and found that amazon had the best price. Then I was pleasantly surprised when the unit arrived that it also plays the ipod, and a usb thumb-drive which plays mp3s and other av devices. I hooked it up to my surround sound system and it now appears that I have a higher end system than I was anticipating. The sound is phenomenal!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Haskin

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my 10 year old Sony with this and was listening to music in a matter of minutes
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 10 year old Sony Five CD changer with this. It arrived to my business the day after I ordered it. I removed the old player, plugged this one in (took less than five minutes to swap out), and was playing music in no time. The clarity is much better compared to the old player and the price was right. Now I can once again listen to clear music instead of static on the FM radio station.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the one I had that I broke trying to gat a cd out of. I thought this 5 CD player was probably not made anymore until I googled it and saw Amazon sold one. I went without my cd music for almost 2 years but with Christmas around the corner I could not go without my Christmas entertaining music on Christmas Day. I am extremely happy with it. The one I had before worked for 19 years until I broke it.
customer_reviews.author: S Butler

customer_reviews.title: Works great. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: I really can't tell how it stacks up against comparable changers. But it sounds good, works fine, and for $109.00 it works for me. I bought a $600 Rotel changer about 12 years ago. The changer mechanism was erratic after two years and Rotel eventually sent me a new model refurbished about 5 years ago. The changer mechanism has been giving me trouble for 3 years. The sound quality is very good, but for $600 , not a good value. This Sony will probably outlast the Rotel.
customer_reviews.author: Dandal Dampier

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  SONY CDP-CE500 PLAYER IS AN EXCELLENT PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.text: This player exceeded my expectations. I can find absolutely nothing to complain about. The sound is amazing. It plays the CDs I recorded from vinyl records as well as manufacturer's perfectly. It is super easy to operate with the remote control and is easy to install. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance, nice controls
customer_reviews.text: This CD player performs exactly as you would expect and the controls seem more intuitive than the previous Sony model which this replaces. The carriage with 5 discs is very nice. Mechanically, it is smooth a reasonably quiet. The player also has a USB port on the front of the machine. It plays USB content nicely, but the info display about the content of the USB drive is very basic.
customer_reviews.author: Loring

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the pricd
customer_reviews.text: This was a reconditioned unit, and it works great. Not fancy, but I didn't need fancy
customer_reviews.author: goathugger

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: I have a large collection of CDs and when my CD player stopped working without constant attention, I bought this one. It has been working quite well, changing discs, opening and closing the tray, and otherwise going smoothly. I have not tried functions like Random play, nor playing from a thumb drive, and probably won't for a long time. But at this price, it's been great. And, the big box stores do not have CD players! The sales people don't even know what I was asking for.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my 25+ year old Sony CD player and is an updated version of what I had and now includes a USB port. I am techno challenged, but easily got it hooked up and playing my fav CD's and will soon figure out how to use record music on a thumb drive.
customer_reviews.author: dck

customer_reviews.title: If you still use CD's, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid, reliable product. I realize CD's are now an "old" technology, but as I have a fair number of them that I will play from time to time, having a multiple disc player unit is a nice thing to have. I have a Sony compact audio system (I think it's model CMT-X5CD) that has a single CD slot that I connected this player to (via a Y Cable splitter) to get the benefit of a multi-changer.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: My old Sony cd changer died on me a week ago. Saw this one on Amazon and liked it mainly because it's a Sony and also because it was quite similar to my old one which was over 15 years old. This was super easy to connect, even to someone as technologically challenged as me. I played it for 5 hours straight today and had no problems. It shuts off automatically when it stops playing which is a great feature for me since I'm notorious for forgetting to turn it off. Haven't tried the USB port yet though. I thought the price was a bargain and even with the free shipping it only took 4 days to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Technologically challenged

customer_reviews.title: Clunker
customer_reviews.text: Well, you get what you pay for. I knew this when I ordered it but had a previous model. It was OK, so I thought "Why not, it is cheap" Yes it is cheap. The mechanism makes a lot of noise in getting to the CD. Play is fine. This player requires use of the remote for certain features, such as "shuffle". I like to be able to pick up 5 discs and push shuffle. Guess I will evolve to making playlists on my computer and forget a CD player all together.
customer_reviews.author: James Bays

customer_reviews.title: Like the features
customer_reviews.text: My old 5 disc player died & I was thrilled to find this Sony... I still have many CDs which I wasn't interested in downloading. So I may be old fashioned but this one works! The buttons are small but once I get used to the location on the player, it will be like an old friend. The disc changer rotates to #1 or the if only 1 disc is on tray, it will rotate to that one when the tray is opened & is very convenient. The remote control is convenient also and this changer was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: BonnieLou

customer_reviews.text: Bought less than two years ago for $125 including tax. Don't like it. I've dug out an old boom box for when I want to play one CD, rather than having music playing endlessly. I find this Sony slow and sometimes puzzling to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rod H.

customer_reviews.title: Way Better Than I Expected
customer_reviews.text: Some of the comments of audiophiles among these reviews had made me wary of this model, but after four months I can say that it has performed excellently with no mechanical or audio problems after 4 months of use. The sound quality of both commercial and self-created CDs is excellent. This unit sounds way better than the DVD player I had been using to play CDs, and also better than the older Philips CD player I had before that. A true audiophile could probably point out problems in the quality of my CD playbacks, but I don't have any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: rupescissa

customer_reviews.title: I only purchase Sony products!!!
customer_reviews.text: When my 20 year old 5 disc CD player/changer finally died, I needed to replace it but it had to be a Sony and it had to be a 5 disc CD player/changer. I found this one and it is exactly what I wanted. I purchased the receiver and a set of speakers suggested to go with it. Everything works great......easy hook-up and the CD changer is fairly quiet when changing CDs. I've always had good luck with anything Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: What happened to modern tech?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an 18 year old (yes, 18 years) Panasonic 5-disc player. The first thing that I noticed when I opened the box was that this thing is BIG!! Check the specs and make sure it fits your entertainment center. It is much wider and deeper than our old Panasonic. The other thing I noticed right away was how noisy the disc tray motor was. Wow, nasty. I am keeping the packaging in case it doesn't last through the 1 yr warranty period.... Other than that, it works well and music sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: It is a lot quieter in operation as it switches to another disc and it just looks good.
customer_reviews.text: This CD player replaced a 18 years old JVC CD changer and the first thing I notice is the sound quality especially with MP3s. This Sony has a fuller and smoother sound. It is a lot quieter in operation as it switches to another disc and it just looks good.
customer_reviews.author: James Harrison

customer_reviews.title: DVD player
customer_reviews.text: To replace an older model when I move back to Calif.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Read

customer_reviews.title: Excellent transfer of digital signals
customer_reviews.text: This device works perfectly! Excellent transfer of digital signals. Other carousels I have tried were not as clear and brilliant. I love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Otto Hallbauer

customer_reviews.title: Love this CD player
customer_reviews.text: I am really old school when it comes to stuff like this. In fact I have a vinyl record player sitting on top of this CD player. I love the 5 cd turntable and the mixing feature on the unit. Also, there is a remote that I use when I am on my rowing machine. I had an old Teac cd player that was giving me fits and this one is so nice to use and what else can I say. Oh I forgot you can load your tunes onto a flash drive with this player if you feel the need to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Paul 1946

customer_reviews.title: Everything works great, your basic 5-disc changer
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great, your basic 5-disc changer. One thing I find disappointing is that you can't change the playback mode (shuffle, repeat, etc.) while a disc is playing. So if I decide I want playback to finish after the current disc instead of continuing on to the next one, I can't do that without stopping the playback altogether. Very strange, since I had an old Sony that had no problem doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CD player to replace a 25-year old model. This one has a few more features. The remote works even when located at a large angle from the player. Everything that I have tried with it works well, The sound is just great. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: PaulM

customer_reviews.title: CD Player
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a 15 year old JVC that stopped working. I love the function on this where it will record the music to a flash drive. It won't recognize all flash drives so I bought a Sony 32GB drive to make sure it works everytime. Makes it easier to convert all my music to digital because I can just press play and do other things while the music plays.
customer_reviews.author: Jam til Impact

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, noisy
customer_reviews.text: The good news is that this is still working after almost a year. But this is a surprisingly poor design from Sony. The face is cluttered and it's all black on black so it's impossible to read the buttons without a flashlight. I didn't realize it when I ordered it but my last player (not Sony) had buttons that lit up so much easier to use. Also, it is much noisier than my last player when the tray is switching to a new CD. This makes when I can only describe as a rattling noise. Plays okay but overall feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: susan0808

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for a affordable alternative to systems 3 times the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, simple changer that does what it's supposed to. No frills or fancy DAC, just good solid performance. This unit was purchased for a second audio=only system and surprised with with its flexible features. It's no high-end deck by any means but sometimes you need to step back from the fancy DACs and transports and realize CD technology is so mature, just about everything you buy is going to sound good.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good CD changer
customer_reviews.text: Great disc carousel. Easy to set up. Fairly easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Just One Day
customer_reviews.text: I received the Sony CD player this morning. Thus far, it has exceeded expectations! Easy to install, exquisite sound and easy to use remote control. I still need to explore all of the other features and will keep you informed of my appraisal. What a joy to hear music again in my living room. My Pioneer CD lived a long life of 20 years and met an unexpected and sudden demise, as some of us will.
customer_reviews.author: Markji

customer_reviews.title: Sony CDP-CE500 Compact Disc Player Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: I chose the Sony CD player because my existing Pioneer CD player (with 6 disc magazine cartridge) died after working beautifully for 25 yrs. You can no longer purchase players with the magazine cartridge feature and I wasn't prepared to replace my entire stereo system. The receiver and speakers are still working. The Sony player fits perfectly in my existing stereo cabinet and looks like it belongs there. The only negative is that the remote control does not have volume control buttons. Overall a great player at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Ventura SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Player
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, Simply the best player I''ve ever owned. During the Christmas holidays this thing runs with usb 24/7 for over three weeks continuously. It runs throughout the year very often.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Simple and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a similar 10+ year old CD player and couldn't be more happy. All of the functions are very clear on how to operate, and setup is really just plugging in a few cables. For the price, I amvery impressed with the quality, as I see plenty more CD players that are well above this price without offering much more in terms of features.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: great basic CD player
customer_reviews.text: I am very loyal to Sony. I always look to Amazon for my Sony products. I have not been dissappointed. This came very quickly in the mail, was packed very carefully and was super easy to set up. I have used it with both only one CD and with the carousel full and I've experenced no problems yet. I do not need "high tech" in my life, so this is perfect. It just plays my CDs!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: adequate
customer_reviews.text: 4 years later and it died. i enjoyed it while it worked. two days ago, it refused to play even though it turned on and the platen came out. easier and cheaper to get a new cd changer and i am going integra at this point. the sound profile was adequate for my mid-grade amp/speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Julian T.

customer_reviews.title: This product was good but I returned it because it wasn't what I ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was good but I returned it because it wasn't what I thought it was I thought it was a CD DVD player and an MP3 but was not but if you're looking for just a CD player that's a good one and I'd recommend it Shiloh
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh Mecca

customer_reviews.title: seems like a good product
customer_reviews.text: The low-end CD changers seem to be hit-or-miss. I've had this one for a year or more and haven't had any problems. Doesn't get heavy use, and I'm old, so I'm not stabbing buttons on it all the time. So far, seems like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: CMJ

customer_reviews.title: great cd changer!
customer_reviews.text: great if you have a lot of cds to play!great sound!
customer_reviews.author: robert lesniak

customer_reviews.title: It was basically easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: It was basically easy to set up. The only problem I had was where did the audio wires go to & so I had to call Sony which ended on my TV. Then you had to go to your TV remote control and we ended having to put it on Video 6 to start it. Then you have to turn your compact player on & hit forward. So far it is easy to use & I had no problems. I have had it for only three weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Bought It On Amazon

customer_reviews.title: A real disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a gift. Got the unit out of the box and hooked up to our stereo system. Carousel mechanism worked fine. When playing a disc, sound reproduction was really terrible. Tried all five disc positions and reproduction was bad on all of our audiophile CDs. Packed it up and sent it back to Amazon. Very disappointed with the quality that SONY has been putting out.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: My new Sony CDP-CE500 Compact Disc player
customer_reviews.text: It is very hard to find CD Players in stores, since now we have so many new products that we, older people are not interest in. So, I went into Amazon.com and found and purchased this Sony Compact disc player. It works great, I can again listen to all my cd's. The only thing I did not like is that after the fifth CD is finished, the player, did not start again with the first CD. However, I am used to it now. Otherwise, the unit is great.
customer_reviews.author: shaina

customer_reviews.title: As good as the original I had that lasted 30 YEARS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My original 5 disc SONY CD Player lived for 30 years....constant use. Then, rough handling by another caused it to break. BOO HOO! Luckily, I found the same one and the price was TERRIFIC! So far, so good! I love this and use it every day!
customer_reviews.author: M Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and began listening right away. We started with a self recorded CD to make sure it worked as we like to make compilations of our favorite music to match different moods. Next we tried our flashdrive, which also worked great and, again, the sound was wonderful. Love the remote. We did not hook this up to our TV but it would be easy to do so and hope to in the future. We are completely satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Yarnspinner13

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This worked beautifully! The sound out of my old speakers is the best ever. Christmas music filled my house and made me soar! :-) I would recommend this to any one needing a good changer. I will probably get new speakers soon, to accompany my wonderful new changer and be blown away!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Susan Webb

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, works well, works with universal remote control
customer_reviews.text: We stream most of our music through our computer - mp3 - for conevenience. We replaced our Sony CD player when it "croaked" so that we would have a backup when the computer was down. This player looks like our prior CD player, but works much better with our universal remote control. The sound is good - better than the MP3 stream, as it should be given compression, etc. Good purchase at a good price. Like it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Gaston

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Expected more from SONY.
customer_reviews.text: Bought three years ago, limited use (weekends only), no longer plays new CDs, or burned MP3s. Does still play music via USB drive. SONY quality not what it used to be. Look at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate Amzn

customer_reviews.title: Sony CDP-CE500 Compact Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: "Our Sony CDP-CE500 C.D. Player arrived promptly and in good working order. Thus far, it's performing quite beautifully and makes an excellent addition to our entertainment system. We previously owned a Pioneer PD-4300 C.D. Player, which provided us with many, many years of excellent service. But our new Sony is definitely a "step-up," and we're very pleased, so far. I guess only time will tell, regarding it's "ruggedness." We highly recommend this multi-CD player by Sony..."
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Y

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate and load
customer_reviews.text: This unit works very well. Easy to operate and load. Many features to use that make for a great music selection. A great bargain for people on limited budgets . Save yourself time and money And get one of these. You will be glad you did... Listen to hours of music without the hassles of getting up to mess with changing radio stations or changing one cd. I rate it about 8 on a 1 to 10 scale overall.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl B. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cd player
customer_reviews.text: Very good cd player. The USB function works great. Good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: EDGAR

customer_reviews.title: RUN AWAY
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work , it freezes up every few seconds.and the seller refuses to make it right and I'm stuck with paying for the repairs paid $278.00 already
customer_reviews.author: Charles Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent player
customer_reviews.text: I'm an audiophile and my 20 year old Pioneer started acting weird. I most the time listen to vinyl, but do enjoy putting on some of my favorite CDs when I read or play video games. So far, I've had no problems and love the addition of the USB port. I've hooked it up through a Rotel pre-amp/amp with a pair of Bowers and Wilkens tower speakers and the sound is amazing. I recommend this player for anyone that doesn't want to break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Player
customer_reviews.text: First off not thrilled with the seller- did not package in another box to ship it and luckily i called someone to get it out of the rain! Product essy to set up has awesome ability to play music and record music through a zip drive or from cd, light weight. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Rackers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love this CD player and is still in good condition which was quality built to last.
customer_reviews.author: david adair

customer_reviews.title: Music for hours.
customer_reviews.text: Love it at Christmas. One Christmas song after another, for hours
customer_reviews.author: Jane Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Replacement successful
customer_reviews.text: This player replaced a Sony that was 25 years old. With the new technology, this new model makes my old CDs sound more brilliant. It's the same size as the old one and fits right in. Everything sounds fresh ----- from "Don Giovanni" to Led Zeppelin. If this unit lasts as long as the original one did CDs will be obsolete by then! Vinyl anyone?
customer_reviews.author: Klio

product_meta.title: Sony CDP-CE500 5-Disc CD Changer (Black)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Designed to deliver a superb sound experience, this 5-disc changer features CD-R/RW playback capability so you can enjoy homemade music mixes as well as the latest industry releases. Keep the party going for hours with the CDP-CE500 CD changer. Featuring a 5-disc carousel, you can enjoy your favorite CDs as well as custom playlists recorded on CD-R and CD-RW discs. Expand your listening options and play back MP3, WMA and AAC music files stored on a USB storage device via the USB port. A remote control is also included.

Keep the party going for hours with the Sony CDP-CE500 CD changer Sony's CDP-CE500 makes it easy and enjoyable to play your favorite CDs. The 5-disc carousel allows you to store your a few of your favorite CDs for perennial listening while leaving a spot or two open for whatever music you're in the mood for at the time. Friend make you a mix? Pop it into an open slot, then switch back to your all-time favorite after it's done with the press of a button. Better yet, while the mix is in, if you hear a song that really catches your ear, a text display tells you what it's called so you can look it up later. Having a choice between analog and digital output makes the CDP-CE500 widely compatible with many home theater configurations.

FRONT-PANEL USB PORT
A front-panel USB port accommodates a USB storage device, making it conveniently accessible to play files from a flash drive. In addition to playing music files from this storage device, you can record music from a disc to USB storage using the CD SYNC function. It will record as an MP3 file and you can also transfer a track or file that is being played on the changer.

REMOTE INCLUDED
The unit comes with a fully functional remote which allows you to program the sequence of up to 32 tracks or files, and allows you to select which disc to play or shuffle songs randomly.

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * Media Supported: CDs, CD-R/-RW, CD-R/-RW Multi Session, 8cm CD
 * Decoding Formats: AAC 48kbps to 320kbps; MP3 32 kbps to 320 kbps, VBR; WMA 48 kbps to 192 kbps
 * Display: MP3 file name, ID3 Tag Ver. 1.1 & 2.0
 * Input: USB port
 * Outputs: RCA L/R analog, optical
 * Power requirements: 60Hz 120V
 * Dimensions: 16.9" x 4.3" x 15.7"
 * Weight: 11.4 lbs
feature_bullets: CD Playback : CD(CD-DA), CD-R/-RW, CD-RW/-RW Multi Session, 8cm CD , MP3 (32kpps-320kbps, VBR)
CD Text Display : Mp3 File Name, ID3 Tag Ver. 1.1 & 2.0
tray type: Carousel, Disc Capacity : 5 Disc
Remote control included, 1-Year Parts and Labor Warranty
